issues.description: The problem statement consistently refers to a class named 'Stock' for managing the saloon’s ingredient inventory (e.g., class Stock { … }), whereas both the template and the solution use a class named 'Inventory' for the exact same concept. This mismatch forces students to mentally map 'Stock' ↔ 'Inventory', creating unnecessary confusion about which class to implement or modify.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the Inventory class in both the template and solution repositories to Stock (and update all references accordingly) so that the class name matches the problem statement’s terminology.
